cs113.calendar.model
Class SerializableBackend

java.lang.Object
  cs113.calendar.model.SerializableBackend
All Implemented Interfaces:
Backend
public class SerializableBackend
extends java.lang.Object
implements Backend

Session-persistent storage using Java's serialization facilities (i.e. the Serializable interface). All objects stored in this model must implement the Serializable interface (i.e. SerializableAppointment and SerializableUser).

Author:
Michael Koval
See Also:
SerializableUser, SerializableAppointment

Method Detail

createUser

public User createUser(java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String name)
                throws DuplicateUserIdException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException
Creates a new SerializableUser object, capable of being used with a SerializableBackend. Does not store the user without an explicit call to writeUser().

Specified by:
createUser in interface Backend
Parameters:
id - id that uniquely identifies the newly-created user
name - full name of the newly-created user
Returns:
new user object
Throws:
DuplicateUserIdException
java.lang.NullPointerException
See Also:
SerializableUser.SerializableUser(String, String), Backend.createUser(String, String)

createAppointment

public Appointment createAppointment(java.lang.String desc,
                                     java.lang.String loc,
                                     java.util.Calendar start,
                                     java.util.Calendar end)
                              throws InvalidDateException,
                                     java.lang.NullPointerException
Creates a new SerializableAppointment object, capable of being added to a SerializableUser object. Does not store the user without explicitly being added to a user object.

Specified by:
createAppointment in interface Backend
Parameters:
desc - short description of this appointment or an empty string to indicate that there is no description
loc - location where this appointment occurs or null if this appointment is not related to any specific location
start - starting date and time of the appointment
end - ending date and time of the appointment, must occur after the starting time of the appointment
Returns:
new appointment object
Throws:
InvalidDateException - if the start time occurs after the end time of this appointment.
java.lang.NullPointerException
See Also:
SerializableAppointment.SerializableAppointment(String, String, Calendar, Calendar), Backend.createAppointment(String, String, Calendar, Calendar)

writeUser

public void writeUser(User user)
Description copied from interface: Backend
Writes the provided user to a persistent data source. This method is implementation-defined and the write operation may or may not be immediately executed. The implicit contract of this method, however, guarantees that the user will be written to disk before the application terminates.

Specified by:
writeUser in interface Backend
Parameters:
user - user to store in the persistent data source.
See Also:
Backend.writeUser(cs113.calendar.model.User)

writeAll

public void writeAll()
              throws StorageException
Description copied from interface: Backend
Forces all data writes that may be queued by the writeUser() method to be written to the persistent data source.

Specified by:
writeAll in interface Backend
Throws:
StorageException - if there is a problem writing stuff.
See Also:
Backend.writeAll()
